concept.title: Maps and navigation
concept.shortdesc: You can define the navigation for any set of topics, including a mix of topics in different components.

conbody.p:
Because your navigation isn't tied to the structure you authored the topics in, you can:
Include topics in multiple places, for example when a task occurs in more than one place in a task flow.
Use different maps for feature-oriented ("what can this product do?") and task-oriented ("how do I accomplish my goals?") organizations of the same topics.
Create new maps for audience-specific views.
Nest your topics differently for online display and for print.
Build navigation that includes topics from other parts of an information set, from external sites, and in other content formats (such as samples and PDFs).
